subclassFeature.name: Plague Domain
entries: Gods of Plague 'bless' the mortal world with their vaired and multitudinous creations, a collection of noxious diseases. Deities of the Plague domain include Abhoth, Moander, Nurghleth, Talona, The Horned Rat, and Yurtrus. Followers of these deities seek to spread their god's gifts with the world and can cause chaos amongst poopulated areas, leaving strife and suffering in their wake; while rare people may often turn to this path to gain a reprieve from their own afflictions through service to such deities.
At each indicated cleric level, add the listed spells to your spells prepared. They do not count towards your limit.

subclassFeature.name: Bonus Cantrips
entries: When you choose this domain at 1st level, you gain the {@spell vector|FFPlagueCleric} and {@spell wrack|FFPlagueCleric} cantrips. These cantrips don't count against the number of cleric cantrips you know. For you, these cantrips count as cleric cantrips.

subclassFeature.name: Contagious Contact
entries: Also at 1st level, you are already considerably contagious. When a creature within 5 feet of you that you can see hits you with an attack, you can use your reaction to cause the creature to make a Constitution saving throw. The creature takes {@damage 1d8} poison or necrotic damage (your choice) and is {@condition poisoned} until the end of your next turn on a failed saving throw, or half as much damage and isn't {@condition poisoned} on a successful one.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (a minimum of once). You regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity: Inflict Disease
entries: Starting at 2nd level, you can use your Channel Divinity to inflict devastating diseases.

As an action, you present your holy symbol, and one creature that is within 30 feet of you must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target is {@condition poisoned} and suffers the effects of one of the following diseases (of your choice) for 1 minute.

entries.name: Blinding Sickness
entries: Pain grips the creature's mind, and its eyes turn milky white. The creature has disadvantage on Wisdom checks and Wisdom saving throws and is {@condition blinded}.

entries.name: Filth Fever
entries: A raging fever sweeps through the creature's body. The creature has disadvantage on Strength checks, Strength saving throws, and attack rolls that use Strength.

entries.name: Flesh Rot (9th level required)
entries: The creature's flesh decays. The creature has disadvantage on Charisma checks and vulnerability to all damage.

entries.name: Mindfire (9th level required)
entries: The creature's mind becomes feverish. The creature has disadvantage on Intelligence checks and Intelligence saving throws, and the creature behaves as if under the effects of the {@spell confusion} spell during combat.

entries.name: Seizure
entries: The creature is overcome with shaking. The creature has disadvantage on Dexterity checks, Dexterity saving throws, and attack rolls that use Dexterity.

entries.name: Slimy Doom (9th level required)
entries: The creature begins to bleed uncontrollably. The creature has disadvantage on Constitution checks and Constitution saving throws. In addition, whenever the creature takes damage, it is {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn.
At the end of each of the target's turns, it can repeat the Constitution saving throw. On a success, the {@condition poisoned} condition and the effects of the disease end.

subclassFeature.name: Acolyte of Affliction
entries: Starting at 6th level your dabbling with disease grants you special abilities:

items: You gain advantage on saving throws against poison, and resistance to poison damage.
Poison damage dealt by your cleric spells and subclass features ignores resistance to poison damage.
You are immune to the effects of diseases, but are still contagious.

subclassFeature.name: Potent Spellcasting
entries: Starting at 8th level, you add your Wisdom modifier to the damage you deal with any cleric cantrip.

subclassFeature.name: Blessed Strikes
entries: {@i 8th-level cleric {@variantrule optional class features|tce|optional feature}, which replaces the Potent Spellcasting feature}

You are blessed with divine might in battle. When a creature takes damage from one of your cantrips or weapon attacks, you can also deal {@damage 1d8} necrotic damage to that creature. Once you deal this damage, you can't use this feature again until the start of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Priest of Plague
entries: At 17th level, your accursed affinity with pestilence and plague becomes more powerful:

items: You gain immunity to poison damage and the {@condition poisoned} condition.

Whenever you cast a spell of 1st level or higher that deals poison or necrotic damage or inflicts the {@condition poisoned} condition, you can choose a number of creatures equal to the spell's level within 15 feet of you to make a Constitution saving throw against your spell save DC. On a failed save they become {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. At the end of each of the target's turns, it can repeat the Constitution saving throw. On a success, the {@condition poisoned} condition ends

spell.name: Bless with Filth
entries: You touch a nonmagical weapon, imbuing it with noxious poisons.
Until the spell ends, the weapon deals an extra {@damage 1d4} poison damage to any target hit by the weapon. If the weapon isn't magical, it becomes a magic weapon for the spell's duration.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the extra damage increases by {@dice 1d4} for every two slot levels above 1st.

spell.name: Wither
entries: {@i With dark chanting you cast a spell of wasting, shrinking sickness and corrosion.}

Choose one target within range, they must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, until the spell ends the target's Constitution score is reduced by 3 and their movement speed is halved. The target dies if this reduces its Constitution to 0. The decrease to the target's Constitution also decreases its maximum hit points, the amount it decreases by is also removed from its current hit points; this lasts until the spell ends.
At the end of each of the target's turns, it can make a Constitution saving throw against the spell. On a success, the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Cloud of Corruption
entries: {@i You release a stinking blast of diseased fury.}

Each creature within 15 feet of you must make a Constitution saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 3d6} poison damage and {@damage 4d6} necrotic damage and is {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute on a failed save, or half as much damage and isn't {@condition poisoned} on a successful one.
A {@condition poisoned} creature may repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the {@condition poisoned} condition on a success.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the necrotic damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Plague
entries: {@i You unleashes a vile disease that scours the battlefield in search of victims to infect.}

Choose one creature that you can see within range to make a Constitution saving throw. It takes {@damage 3d6} poison damage and {@damage 2d6} necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one.
Then, roll on the following table:

rows.name: Backfire!
entries: The nearest creature to the current target that is friendly to you (including yourself) and within range becomes the new target of the spell and it must a Constitution saving throw as if it was the original target of the spell.
If there is more than one possible target, the DM chooses between the targets. If there are no valid targets within range, the spell ends.
Then, roll on this table again.

rows.name: Dissipate
entries: The spell ends with no further effect.

rows.name: Spread!
entries: The nearest creature to the current target that is hostile to you and within range becomes the new target of the spell and it must a Constitution saving throw as if it was the original target of the spell.
If there is more than one possible target, you choose between the targets. If there are no valid targets within range, the spell ends.
Then, roll on this table again.
A creature can only be the target of this spell once each time it is cast.

components.m: a sprinkling of several dead fleas

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the necrotic damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Vector
entries: Choose one creature you can see within range, they must succeed a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature has disadvantage on saving throws against diseases for 1 minute.
This spell's duration increases when you reach certain levels: 10 minutes at 5th level, 1 hour at 11th level, and 8 hours at 17th level.

spell.name: Wrack
entries: One creature of your choice you can see within range experiences a jolt of searing pain and must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save the target takes {@damage 1d4} psychic damage and {@damage 1d4} necrotic damage.
This spell's psychic and necrotic damage increases by {@dice 1d4} each when you reach 5th level ({@damage 2d4} each), 11th level ({@damage 3d4} each), and 17th level ({@damage 4d4} each).
